intro: Rinorea borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, velvety purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate with a glossy surface, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
